intro: Neoporteria jussieui var. chaniarensis, commonly known as the Chaniarensis variety of the Neoporteria genus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its ornamental leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Native to specific regions in South America, this plant thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in gardens and as a houseplant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within the Malvaceae family.
